Name: Coffin
Description: An outer and inner pair of coffins, belonging to Ta-enty. The outer box is plain, the yellow painted lid is mummiform and the wig is painted in blue, red and yellow stripes. A single vertical line of inscription runs down the centre of the lid, consisting of the standard htp-dj-nsw formula (see 'Hieroglyphs'). The hieroglyphs are painted in black on a white background edged with blue. There is some damage to the panels at the foot end.
